Package de.ukbonn.mwtek.dashboard.services

Class FhirSearchService

java.lang.Object
de.ukbonn.mwtek.dashboard.auth.RestConsumer
de.ukbonn.mwtek.dashboard.services.FhirSearchService
All Implemented Interfaces:
SearchService
@Service public class FhirSearchService extends RestConsumer implements SearchService
Service for providing the FhirSearchConfiguration (e.g. which Loinc codes are to be used) from application.yaml.

  • Method Details

    • getBundleData

      public List<org.hl7.fhir.r4.model.Bundle.BundleEntryComponent> getBundleData(String querySuffix)
      Retrieve a FHIR search query and parse the result in FHIR bundle entry components This method is used when pagination is not necessary.
      Specified by:
      getBundleData in interface SearchService
      Parameters:
      querySuffix - The suffix with the FHIR search logic to be appended to the FHIR server endpoint url (e.g. Patient?id=1).
      Returns:
      The response from the FHIR search query, parsed into a FHIR bundle entry components

    • getInitialBundle

      public org.hl7.fhir.r4.model.Bundle getInitialBundle(String querySuffix)
      If the query of all entries of a particular FHIR resource needs to be split (for performance reasons, for example), the meta-information must be retrieved at bundle level (e.g. the link to the next offset), not at bundle entry level.
      Specified by:
      getInitialBundle in interface SearchService
      Parameters:
      querySuffix - The suffix with the FHIR search logic to be appended to the FHIR server endpoint url (e.g. Patient?id=1).
      Returns:
      The response from the FHIR search query, parsed into a FHIR Bundle object

    • getBundlePart

      public org.hl7.fhir.r4.model.Bundle getBundlePart(String linkToNextPart)
      After execution, the initial FHIR search query returns the attributes "self" and "next" within the attribute "link" if the number of resources to be retrieved is too large. These values can be used to control pagination and are used to retrieve additional FhirBundleParts Since the URL is already supplied in the "next" attribute (in contrast to method getInitialBundle(String)) simplified handling is possible here, since the FHIR search query no longer has to be assembled.
      Specified by:
      getBundlePart in interface SearchService
      Parameters:
      linkToNextPart - The FHIR search query to retrieve the next FHIR Bundle block via Bundle.getLink().
      Returns:
      The response from the FHIR search query, parsed into a FHIR Bundle object.
